Articles.Content:
Game simply crashes on start. Log here, no -force-glcore doesn't do anything. It never has and never will, because it doesn't actually do anything if there's no dirextX mode. -force-glcore32 doesn't help either, which is new. This is prerelease 1532.

Edited September 26, 2016 by Requia

This is a known issue, seems like it doesn't like windowed mode on Linux. I opened my settings file in a text editor and changed Fullscreen to True, which works well for me. For every new version I copy the settings file into the new folder before starting the first time. But yeah, check the tracker for this, it's definitely on there.
No change from setting it to fullscreen, not even the expected momentary fullscreen before crashing.
Works fine for me (Windowed or full-screen). 1.2.0.1532; Debian GNU/Linux "Jessie", running Kernel 4.6.0 and NVidia proprietary drivers 352.79 with KDE. CPU is AMD Phenom II X4 965.
Try updating Mono and running it again. I suspect your Mono install is out of date.

2 hours ago, Jovus said:

Try updating Mono and running it again. I suspect your Mono install is out of date.

Doesn't KSP use it's own bundled Mono? I've never had to mess with system libs when running it, I presume it is built statically.

38 minutes ago, Waxing_Kibbous said:

Doesn't KSP use it's own bundled Mono?

Yes it does, Unity forked mono ages ago and a copy of the same is included in the archive, i.e. KSP_linux/KSP_Data/Mono/x86_64/libmono.so. Unitys mono isn't compatible with upstream / distro packages any more either.

On the crashing, the OP is pretty thin on system details etc... what GPU driver are you using?
Perhaps this bug is still alive:

On 19/04/2013 at 9:29 AM, sal_vager said:

"KSP doesn't start!" (New for 1.1)

Current proprietary AMD drivers are breaking with the Unity multi-threaded rendering, force single threaded rendering with the following in a terminal:

KSP.x86_64 -force-gfx-direct

 

Edited September 27, 2016 by steve_v

Please post output of:

lsmod | grep -E "radeon|amdgpu|fglrx"

and

lspci -nnk | grep -i vga -A3 | grep 'driver'

and

glxinfo | grep -i opengl

to understand what AMD driver are you actually running.

20 hours ago, steve_v said:

Yes it does, Unity forked mono ages ago and a copy of the same is included in the archive, i.e. KSP_linux/KSP_Data/Mono/x86_64/libmono.so. Unitys mono isn't compatible with upstream / distro packages any more either.

On the crashing, the OP is pretty thin on system details etc... what GPU driver are you using?

 

[/quote]

Uh, the radeon driver has never worked with KSP, so fglrx is kindof inferred.

Also this forum software is an absolute mess.

20 hours ago, steve_v said:
Quote

 

Perhaps this bug is still alive:

{/quote] That seems to do it. Or at least I'm back to the weird broken resolutions everybody else is having.

 

Edited September 27, 2016 by Requia
Why yes, the forum software is horrible. I'd quote you, but quoting anthing on mobile leads to the kind of ridiculous mess we have seen here...
